intro: Sida yunnanensis var. viridicaulis, commonly known as the green-stem sida, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, green stems and small, ovate leaves. It produces clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in summer. This variety is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and riverbanks.
